intro: Ruizterania obtusata subsp. multivenosa, commonly known as the broad-leafed ruizterania, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with multiple veins, giving it the subspecies name *multivenosa*. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Ruizterania obtusata subsp. multivenosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
